v - t - e Indirect presidential elections were held in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) on 30 December 1970, following the death of the incumbent, [Yusof Ishak](/wiki/Yusof_Ishak). The election took place during a sitting of Parliament on 30 December 1970 where 54 members were present and 4 members were absent. Prime Minister [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) nominated Benjamin Sheares as president. The Parliament unanimously voted to elect Sheares as president. Sheares was sworn in for his first four-year term as president on 2 January 1971. ## Results CandidatePartyVotes%[Benjamin Sheares](/wiki/Benjamin_Sheares)Independents54100.00Total54100.00Total votes54â€“Registered voters/turnout5893.10 This Singapore-related article is a stub. title: 1970 Singaporean presidential election
